property_title: 44 Prospect View, Prospect Manor, Rathfarnham, Dublin 16
property_description:
Upstairs







Viewing by appointment only

Gary O&s; Driscoll &a; Co Ltd (PSR Licence No: 003250) is delighted to bring this 3 bedroom newly refurbished, beautifully finished mid-terraced dwelling for sale to the market. The property is to the highest standard and has recently been updated and now offers the discerning purchaser a turn-key walk in property. 

The property benefits from an air to water central heating system, triple glazed PVC windows &a; doors, a heat recovery exchanger, also an under floor heating system on the ground floor with oversized rads upstairs. The property also benefits from a large rear garden that has been completely renovated with a garage that has the potential to be converted into a form of accommodation. 

The property is located within walking distance to Tralee town centre  most amenities such as Bon Secours Hospital, Garveys Super Valu, Holy Family &a; Ballonagh primary school.

1 Seaview is a three bedroom, two bathroom townhouse with the bonus of an incorporated garage space with potential for varies uses. 

This is a unique opportunity to live on one of Clontarf’s premier Roads. Hollybrook Road and its tree lined, Victorian grandeur joins the seafront promenade on the Clontarf Road and the Howth Road. It’s popularity is reflective of its location only minutes from Clontarf train station and steps away from the seafront and cycle track leading to the famed wooden bridge, Dollymount Strand and beyond to Howth. The other direction brings you to the heart of Dublin City centre via Dart, bus or cycle lane within minutes. The location is the epitome of convenience. 

This modern townhouse consists of on the ground floor, an entrance hallway with a Shower room. A large, bright open plan living area with a modern fully fitted kitchen. There is also a garage room with a roller shutter door accessing the street, providing opportunities for varies uses, such as home gym or work station. Subject to planning permission the option of creating an additional living space is also obvious.  Upstairs there are three bedrooms and a bathroom.

The house is in good condition throughout, and in the perfect location this home will have wide appeal for first time buyers, investors or those trading down in the area but not wanting to lose the many benefits of Clontarf living.

Welcome to No. 239 Marina Village, a superb own front door, end of terrace one bedroom ground floor apartment with the added benefit of a sunny west facing patio garden. Upon entering viewers will appreciate the bright and spacious living accommodation which comprises of entrance hallway with sliding storage press, bedroom with built in wardrobes, bathroom and open plan living / dining area with kitchen to the side. There are French doors to a sunny west facing patio garden off the living area.  Malahide Marina is a very well maintained development set in an enviable location within easy reach of all city transport hubs.  A short stroll will take you to the centre of Malahide Village and all of its amenities including restaurants, shops, boutiques and numerous sports facilities. Sure to attract first time buyers, investors or those looking to down size. Viewing comes is highly recommended.

property_title: 17 Park Street West, The Ranch, Ballyfermot, Dublin 10
property_description:
Berkeley &a; Associates are delighted to offer this superbly located one bedroom cottage for sale. Tucked away within the ever popular area locally known as ‘The Ranch’, Inchicore Village is just a short stroll away.
On a direct bus route and easily accessible to the Chapelizod Bypass &a; Con Colbert Road, Heuston Station is a mere 2.5km away with Dublin City Centre only 5km away. 
Whilst requiring comprehensive updating, this quaint home offers huge potential for the owner occupier or discerning investor seeking good value in a central location.

McGovern Estates is delighted to present   256  Charlesland Wood. This bright and spacious 2 bedroom townhouse is presented in excellent condition throughout and benefits from a private rear garden. An impressive attic conversion with ample eaves storage also features. Internal viewing of No. 256 is highly recommended. 

This beautifully presented two bedroom townhouse extends to 78m2 (840 sq.ft.) with a 16m2 (172sq.ft) attic conversion which provides additional space for a new owner. The accommodation briefly comprises a kitchen / dining area, living room, a downstairs WC, 2 bedrooms, a family bathroom and an attic conversion 16m2.

No.256 is located in Charlesland Wood, a peaceful setting in the Charlesland development within close proximity to a wide range of amenities and the Charlesland shopping centre is just a short walk away.

Greystones Town is within easy reach and all your needs will be catered for with a wonderful selection of bistros, boutiques, restaurants and shops, the village library, churches and a large number of highly regarded schools.

A host of sport and leisure clubs abound in the area including sailing, rowing, football, rugby, tennis and GAA. The Shoreline Leisure Centre and swimming pool is on the doorstep, as are a great choice of renowned golf clubs, including Greystones, Powerscourt and Druids Glen.

Greystones is situated in a stunning location between the coast and the Wicklow mountains, giving easy access to the local beaches, countryside and nearby villages of Delgany and Enniskerry.

The commuter will be delighted at the easy access to local bus stops and the DART station both within walking distance. The N11/ M50 is also within easy reach making for an easy commute to the city, airport and beyond.

property_title: 5 Cedar Hall, Millbrook Village, Milltown,   Dublin 6
property_description: Lynam Auctioneers are delighted to Present No.5 Cedar Hall. Located just off the Milltown Road and very near to the Sandford Road/Clonskeagh Road Junction, it is 10 minutes walk to the center of Ranelagh village and all of its amenities. This ground floor property comprises of a large living room with a terrace, dining room, separate fully fitted kitchen, 2 large double bedrooms, master ensuite and main bathroom. There are two designated car spaces included, There is also a tennis court and a gym(local charge) for the exclusive use of the residents. Close to the LUAS. The complex also has a locked storage room for bicycles.

Berkeley &a; Associates are delighted to offer this very well located and conveniently positioned three bedroom mid-terrace residential dwelling situated in the heart of popular old Palmerstown. Located just off the N4 close to local boys’ and girls’ national schools, St. Lorcan’s and St. Brigid’s and also accessible to SuperValu and the M50 at the junction 7 which is only a mile away and Liffey Valley shopping and leisure complex.

  Viewing is Highly Recommended.
  
See our video tour on www.berkeley.ie

property_title: Apt 38 Harbourview, Kincora Harbour, Killaloe, Clare
property_description: Harry Brann Auctioneers offer you the opportunity to acquire a 3 bedroomed ground floor apartment  in excellent turn-key condition, located in a much sought-after development at Kincora Harbour, within easy walking distance of all amenities in the popular lakeside town of Killaloe.

Hunters Estate Agent are delighted to introduce to the market this very fine three-bedroom mid-terrace home. Extending to a generous 92.9sq.m/1,003sq.ft the property was fully renovated by the current owners in 2016 to include insulation, wiring, plumbing, windows, flooring and a stylish kitchen and bathroom. No expense has been spared to create this stylish property set in a quiet position in the heart of Perrystown. Throughout the property benefits from generous proportions and there is a wonderful quality of light. Outside the owners have landscaped both the front and rear gardens with stunning granite paving and artificial grass. All in all, this is a wonderful turnkey home that will appeal to many buyers.

Upon entering the property, one is welcomed by a generous hall with engineered oak flooring, staircase rising to the first floor, cloaks cupboard and understairs storage. To the right a bright living room also boasts engineered oak flooring. To the rear the owners have created a lovely kitchen/dining room boasting a hand-crafted kitchen with a stunning island, wooden countertop and large sliding door leading to the landscaped rear patio and garden. Rising to the first floor one finds two large double bedrooms and a spacious single. The main bedroom has excellent built-in wardrobes and sits to the rear of the house. Completing the accommodation is a stylish bathroom with feature bath and sink.

Outside to the rear the landscaped rear garden boasts a granite patio, granite path, artificial lawn and wooden shed which is wired and plumbed for washing machine and dryer. The garden is bounded by concrete walls on two sides and a mature hedge on the third. To the front the generous off-street parking area has also been landscaped and is laid out in gravel with granite pathway leading to granite steps to the front door. The owners have built in a useful wooden bin store.

Hogan Durkan are pleased to present this immaculate three bed semi-detached property in the highly desirable Glanntan development, Golf Links Road, Castletroy. Number 307 is located on a quiet cul-de-sac consisting of 10 semi-detached properties at the rear of the development and is an ideal first-time buyers home in one of Limericks most desirable addresses. 

Glanntan is superbly located off the Golf Links Road, with close access to the M7 and benefits from being in close proximity to a range of services and facilities such as Monaleen National School, Monaleen GAA &a; Tennis Club, Castletroy Golf Club, Castletroy College Secondary School, University of Limerick, National Technology Park, Castletroy Park Hotel, Kilmurry Lodge Hotel and Castletroy Town Centre to name but a few. 
It is also in close proximity to Limerick City Centre(6.1km), University Hospital Limerick(8.8km), Raheen Business Park(12.4km) and Shannon International Airport (32km). The immediate area is also serviced by Bus Eireann Route 304A Raheen via Ul Stables.

Number 307 will appeal to a wide range of potential buyers. Those looking to get on the property ladder, it is ready to hang your coat up and stamp your own style on this fantastic three bed property. Those looking for low maintenance gardens, the tarmacadamed front drive and paved enclosed rear garden will appeal while still providing garden shed, decking, raised garden beds and mature planting creating a wonderful garden ambience. Viewing is Highly Recommended!

property_title: Kingstown Mews, 5 Park Lane, Dun Laoghaire, County Dublin
property_description:
This is a rare opportunity to purchase a unique, spacious (152.2 sqm/1638.3 sq ft) and most attractive excellently finished four bedroom mews residence in a superb location beside The People&s;s Park, Dun Laoghaire pier and within easy walking of Dun Laoghaire Town Centre, Glasthule Village and Sandycove DART station.

With so many local amenities on the doorstep, together with the deceptively spacious accommodation, Kingstown Mews is suitable for all potential purchasers, including individuals, couples, young families and people trading down. 

Accommodation briefly comprises hallway, living room, dining room/kitchen, utility room, office and downstairs cloakroom while upstairs there are four bedrooms and two bathrooms. Outside there is a large rear courtyard. There is vehicular access through a sliding gate directly from Park Lane, with private parking.  There is also a permit for local parking on Park Lane.  

There are is a wide selection of schools nearly including Sharavogue Creche, Montessori and Junior Schools, The Harold&s;s Schools, St Patrick&s;s National School Dalkey, Castlepark School, and Loreto Dalkey and by DART to Blackrock College, St Andrew’s College, CBC Monkstown and many more.

There is a  myriad of water sports in and around Dun Laoghaire, Sandycove (The Forty Foot) and Killiney. These, together with many interesting walks such as The People&s;s Park, Monkstown Foreshore and Killiney Hill close by, make Kingstown Mews a superb choice for  the discerning purchaser looking for leisure and convenience.

Viewing is strongly recommended.

David Scally of David Ross Estate Agents your local property experts are delighted and proud to present new to the market for sale 17 Clogher Road.
 
If you are looking for a lifestyle of privacy for your family and friends, this elegant and lavish, 2 bedrooms, extended and with a converted terrace home offers all this and more. Number 17 is a truly exquisite home and has been beautifully extended, decorated and modernised by its proud current owners.
 
With a double story extension to the rear as well as an attic conversion this is one of the largest homes to come for sale in Crumlin in recent times. 
You feel at home upon entering this beautiful home, with a large reception room to the front. Through double doors you will find the modern kitchen/dining room with plenty of storage and worktop space. Also, to the rear of the property you will find a guest w/c and utility room. Outside to the rear there is a low maintenance paved garden that is bathed in natural sunlight and the perfect place to unwind after a long day 
 
Upstairs you will find two generous bedrooms (one single &a; one double) as well as a large storage room currently in use as a double bedroom and also the modern fully tiled family bathroom. The attic has also been converted for easy storage but is also in use as a double bedroom.
 
The residence is comprised over three spacious levels and has been beautifully put together offering sumptuous comfort, bright living accommodation and loads of storage space, crafted with exquisite detail, no expense has been spared. 
 
Supremely located in this much sought-after area of Crumlin, within a short distance of the Terenure, Rathfarnham, Sundrive and Crumlin Villages offering a selection of shops, restaurants, schools, parks and sports facilities. Also, within easy access to the M7, M50 and Dublin City Centre. There is a host of public transport links also less than 5 minutes’ walk from your door making the commute to City centre fast and simple. Inspection is simply a must for the astute and discerning purchaser! Viewing by appointment only
 
Features
G.F.C.H 
Double glazed windows 
Excellent location 
Double story extension
Attic conversion 
Turnkey condition 
Off street parking

property_title: 27 The Heath, Liffey Hall, Newbridge, Kildare
property_description:
Maura Donohoe Auctioneers are delighted to present new to the market 27 The Heath, Liffey Hall. A beautiful two story semi-detached residence that comes to market in excellent condition throughout. Accommodation comprises of entrance hall, family sitting room, open plan kitchen/dining room, four spacious bedrooms with master en-suite &a; main family bathroom. The property boasts spacious living, mature front &a; rear large gardens, double glazed windows, gas fired central heating &a; much more. Liffey Hall is a family friendly estate &a; is only a short walk/drive to the bustling town of Newbridge with educational, recreational, Whitewater Shopping Centre all in hand The development is located just off the Athgarvan Road on the outskirts of Newbridge town and only a short walk from Curragh Plains. Commuters have the benefit of the M7 Motorway, bus routes and commuter rail service close by. This property is also within close proximity to a small shopping centre to include Centra supermarket, hairdressers, beauticians, crèche, family doctors and pharmacy.
Viewing of this property is highly recommended


Entrance Hall: c. 2.62m x 1.72m
Bright entrance hall, ceramic tiled flooring, carpet on stairs, under stairs storage, coving, wall lights, light fitting. 

Sitting Room: c. 3.37m x 5.14m
Beautiful spacious sitting room, wooden floor, feature ornate marble fireplace with marble heart, coving, centre rose, wall lights, light fitting, double French doors into open plan kitchen/dining room. 

Kitchen/Dining Room: c.5.52m x 5.94m
Open plan L shaped kitchen with adjoining dining room, wooden floor with tiled flooring in kitchen area, country cream fitted kitchen units with integrated oven, hob, extractor fan, fridge freezer, tiled splashback, coving, light fittings x 3, wall lights, double French doors leading into sitting room, double French doors leading onto rear garden. 

Utility Room: c. 2.34m x 3.15m 
Ceramic tiled flooring, fitted units, light fitting, pedestrian back door. 

Guest WC: c. 1.54m x 7.55m
Tiled flooring, WHB, WC, light fitting. 

Landing: 
Carpet, hot press, light fitting.

Bedroom 1: c. 3.19m x 3.36m 
Master bedroom, wooden floor, double fitted wardrobes with built in vanity unit. 

En-suite: c. 1.04m x 2.37m 
Fully tiled, WHB, WC, shower cubicle, light fitting. 

Bedroom 2: c. 3.13m x 4.62m 
Double bedroom, wooden floor, double fitted wardrobes, curtains, light fitting. 

Bedroom 3: c. 2.65m x 2.11m 
Wooden floor, double fitted wardrobes, curtains, light fitting. 

Bedroom 4 (Downstairs)/Family Room: c. 5.40m x 2.38m 
Wooden floor, coving, blinds, light fitting, the room can be used as 4th bedroom or family room, office/study. 

Main Family Bathroom: c. 2.20m x 1.66m 
Part-tiled, WHB, WC, bath with glass shower door, blinds, light fitting. 



Additional Features 
Gas fired central heating 
Fully alarmed 
Double glazed windows  
PVC fascia &a; soffit 
Large manicured rear garden with mature trees, plants &a; flowers
Large front rear garden with driveway 
Off street parking
Large pedestrian side entrance with gate
Barna shed
Outdoor lights
Outdoor tap
Presented in excellent condition throughout
Private cul de sac
Family friendly development 
Within walking distance to all local amenities

REA BROPHY FARRELL are delighted to bring to the market this well-proportioned spacious family home which is presented in excellent decorative order throughout and is situated in a mature and sought after location in the heart of Clonmoyle West, Rathangan, Co Kildare. 

To visit our 3D virtual tour please follow the link below: 

https://my.matterport.com/show/?m=w1q92BSEaic

Early viewing is highly recommended.

Seldom does an apartment come to the market with such a beautiful setting overlooking Dun Laoghaire Harbour, Dublin Bay and the city.  The ultimate in apartment living No 41 Harbour View is an immaculately maintained three-bedroom penthouse which is presented in show house condition throughout and offers the ultimate in apartment living. The enviable property will greatly appeal to all those looking for a secure, chic residence in a highly desirable location, suitable for those who wish to downsize or upsize.   

A great sense of space is immediately evident as you walk through the door and is present throughout the accommodation of this seventh-floor residence.  Floor to ceiling windows coupled with its dual aspect orientation, ensure an abundance of natural light fills the apartment and allows for the discerning purchaser to take full advantage of the dramatic day and night time views which it affords.  

Finished to an excellent standard, the entrance hall leads through to the large open plan kitchen / living / dining with breathtaking views. There are three bedrooms, (2 en-suite), the main of which has its own balcony and a main bathroom.  If you thought this fine apartment couldn&s;t get any better, it also comes with its own designated underground parking space.

The location of this apartment is unrivalled, boasting incredible ease of access to Dun Laoghaire&s;s growing number of popular amenities, both social and essential. It is within a stone&s;s throw of excellent shopping facilities, popular restaurants and the Pavilion Theatre. It is just across the road from the seafront where one can enjoy coastal walks and a wide variety of maritime leisure facilities. Excellent transport links are in abundance in the locality with numerous bus routes, the DART, the Aircoach providing direct access to Dublin Airport.

property_title: 47 Harbour Close, Newtown, Killaloe, Co. Clare
property_description:
M&a;C Property are delighted to introduce 47 Harbour Close, Killaloe to the market for sale. 



The subject property has been finished to a good standard throughout and has been planned out cleverly to maximise brightness and daylight in the living area on the first floor. 



Harbour Close is located adjacent to the Killaloe Hotel &a; Spa and is also just a comfortable and picturesque walk into Killaloe and Ballina villages with their shops, award winning pubs, restaurants and hotels.  For those based further afield, you are only approx. 90 mins to Dublin airport and 30 mins to Shannon Airport.



There is a communal garden area outside the property in which to relax and further take in the peaceful surroundings.



*It should be noted that under the current planning legislation, the property can only be used for short term holiday lettings. 



Killaloe is one of the most instantly recognisable locations in the Mid West area and this is not without good reason. 



The area is a haven for those in love with the outdoors and lists among its many attractions:

New marina

University of Limerick Activity Centre 

Woodland walking trails 

Golf courses 

Fishing 

Archery 

Sailing 

Equestrian facilities 

Swimming pool and leisure centre



Master bedroom: 3.65 X 3.27 €" Access to rear garden Walk in wardrobe: 1.74 X 1.61 Ensuite: 1.56 X 1.8 €" partially tiled, shower, toilet, sink 



Bedroom 2: 3.18 X 4.4 - BIW



Bathroom (Downstairs): 1.85 X 2.24 €" partially tiled, shower over bath, toilet, sink 



Bedroom 3: 3.68 X 3.29 



Bathroom (First Floor): 2.77 X 1.46 €" partially tiled, electric shower, toilet, sink 



Living / Dining Area: 4.4 X 5.29

 

Kitchen: 2 X 3.16 €" tiled floor and splashback

property_features: Beautiful location near Lough Derg and the surrounding countryside
Under current planning legislation the property can only be used for short term holiday lettings
Short distance to Killaloe village and its many, world famous attractions
Myriad of sailing and water sports attractions on your doorstep
Kitchen / living / dining area to the first floor

property_description:
Sherry FitzGerald is delighted to introduce no.16 Riversdale Court to the market. Located just off the Monkstown Road, Riversdale Court is a mature residential enclave in the most convenient of locations. This fine two bedroom, two bathroom ground floor apartment measures 62sq.m/670sq.ft. approx of well-appointed living and sleeping accommodation. Given its highly desirable location, close to Monkstown and Blackrock Villages, no.16 is sure to appeal to owner occupiers and investors alike.

Located on the ground floor, no 16 is a light-filled apartment situated in this mature and well-established development which has always been a popular choice with house hunters in the locality. The accommodation briefly comprises of a welcome entrance hall with a large storage room, a spacious living/dining room with large window looking out to the communal grounds, separate newly fitted kitchen, main double bedroom with en-suite shower room, a double bedroom currently used as a home office and the main bathroom. Within the development there are well-maintained gardens and ample communal parking for residents.

Superbly positioned close to Monkstown and Blackrock, all amenities both social and essential are within striking distance. The local villages offer a wonderful array of cafes, boutiques, restaurants as well as enjoyable coastal walks.  There are also several premier schools close by. Residents of Riversdale Court are spoiled with a number of excellent local transport links including the DART at Seapoint station and several bus routes including the 4 and 7 routes which provide seamless access to the City Centre and beyond.

Viewing is highly advised to fully appreciate all this wonderful property has to offer.

This very spacious , well maintained &a; highly desirable 4 bed home is new to the market in a very sought after area of County Donegal . This property comes set on very spacious gardens with stone walls on the side and rear boundary, also a timber shed for storage sits to the rear of the property .

The very spacious (150sq m ) accommodation comprises a large open plan kitchen and living room combined. This comes with an open fireplace which has a back boiler fitted, timber / tile flooring throughout , double patio  doors which open to the side of the property. The utility room is off the kitchen with a back door to the rear of the property. Entry through the main front door opens to a wide spacious hallway which provides the gateway to the 2 down stairs bedrooms and the fully tiled bathroom with built in bath and separate shower. Off this the natural wood staircase leads to the landing where entry to the very spacious walk in hotpress can be found. From the landing is the very generous sized main bedroom with its own fully tiled en-suite  and a separate and large walk in wardrobe. The other very large bedroom also boasts its own fully tiled en-suite and comes with a walk-in wardrobe for storage. The house is also heated with oil fired central heating. 

The property which was constructed in 2008 also features unobstructed views of mount Errigal and is close to the Airport, local schools and all amenities. It&s;s moments off the N56 on the R257. Some of  the finest beaches in the country are only a short distance away. This would be an ideal family home or would serve as an ideal holiday home due to its perfect location


Features:

- Situated on R257 off N56 within easy reach of beaches, golf, hiking, airport, spa, leisure and beauty centres, swimming pool, gym, restaurants.
- Open-plan sitting room, dining and kitchen 
- Modern interior throughout 
- Both first floor bedrooms are en-suite
- Large lawn garden to front and side
- Off-street parking
- Constructed in 2006
- Oil central heating and double glazing
- Can be sold furnished if required

Walk through this property using our 3D virtual tour........just click the play button above! 

DNG Brian Mac Mahon is delighted to bring to the market this absolutely beautiful, thatched cottage which dates back to the early 19th century and was once owned by Lady Christabel Ampthill as a hunting lodge.  The property is wonderfully presented and maintained, with the well-proportioned rooms boasting good ceiling heights with heaps of character and charm.  

The interior has traditional stone walls, with a vaulted ceiling in the Kitchen/Dining area however the property features contemporary touches, such as the fitted kitchen, and bathroom. Externally to the front the property is gated with a driveway providing sufficient off-street parking.  The enclosed private rear garden has an easily maintained lawn and decking area with numerous sheds.  The thatched roof was recently replaced and is regularly maintained.

The accommodation is comprised as follows: bright entrance, cosy sitting room with feature fireplace, large kitchen/dining area with beautiful feature inglenook fireplace and solid fuel stove. Complementing the kitchen are a spacious utility room and storeroom. There are two good-sized bedrooms which share a spacious walk-in wardrobe.  The family bathroom completes the living accommodation for this attractive home.  

Craughwell is a village in County Galway.  Its village green has a statue of Lady Augusta Gregory, (1852-1932) a founding member of the Irish National Theatre and another of Anthony Raftery (c1784-1835), last of the great Gaelic bards, both by sculptor, Donal O&s; Murhcadha.   The Dunkellin River flows through the village.  The village has various bars, a Garda station, a pharmacy, a furniture store, post office, hairdressers, a service station, a lawnmower shop, an athletics track, and various fast-food takeaways.  It is located around 25km east of Galway City, which can be accessed via the 763 and 20 bus routes. The town of Loughrea is also just 12km to the east and can be accessed by bus also.

Properties in Wheaton Hall always gain deserved attention and this fabulous 3 bedroom detached bungalow with a very desirable detached garage is no exception. Set in a mature sought after development with its enviable location on the south side of Drogheda just off the Dublin Road will appeal to all. Spacious accommodation coupled with best located cul-de-sac will in the development will entice a variety of discerning purchasers. This ready to move-in condition property boasts Approx. 111m²/1200ft² of generous accommodation comprised of Sitting Room, large Kitchen/Dining, Conservatory, 3 Bedrooms with one En-suite and a Family Bathroom. Externally the property is equally as impressive with its ever useful detached garage (Approx. 14.5m²/155ft²) with car access from the side of the property. Furthermore this property is potentially suitable for a roof conversion subject to planning permission for that extra space if required. The superb location is only minutes&s; walk away from several services including Drogheda train station and a host of local amenities such as schools, shops, restaurants, pubs and frequent public transport links to Dublin city centre. Junction 7 of the M1 Motorway is 11km away and it&s;s only a 25 minute drive to Dublin Airport and the M50 orbital Motorway. Viewing is highly recommended by appointment only.

Bohan Hyland &a; Associates are thrilled to present a rare opportunity to acquire a four bedroom detached home in such a popular location. This property is one of a kind in Clondalkin and comes to market with no onward chain providing a quick turnaround for a willing buyer and is presented in need of modernisation throughout.

This home will appeal to first/second time buyers and investors alike and is ideally located close to all local amenities (shops, schools, parks, pubs, restaurants, bus routes etc) and seconds from Clondalkin Village. Rosapenna is within striking distance of the M50, N11 &a; Red Cow Luas stop.

This home briefly comprises of a large living room, open plan kitchen/dining room, extension room, four bedrooms and three bathrooms. Rosapenna sits on a spacious plot which is mostly laid to lawn with decking area and to the front can be found a driveway providing off street parking for multiple cars. Many additional benefits include double glazed windows, gas-fired central heating and electric gates to name but a few.

To view this property call Shane Hanevy today on 01 491 3000.

Number 27 is a truly wonderful 3 bed semi-detached family which is most perfect for everyday modern family life. This fine home offers a stylish, open plan interior which is in immaculate condition. It is evident that no cost was spared by its current owners when undergoing the renovations and the high quality finishes are there to be admired as soon as you set foot through the door. Their attention to detail ensures that this really is a home of true distinction located in a most sought-after South Dublin area. 


This fine property is situated on a quiet cul-de-sac, within strolling distance to Orwell Shopping centre with its many shops including a Supervalu supermarket. This fine modern, open plan accommodation downstairs comprises an extended entrance porch, spacious hall, living room and beautiful kitchen/dining room. Upstairs there are three bedrooms and a family bathroom. Viewing is a must to appreciate what this ideal family home has to offer.


Tymon Park is only a stones throw&s; away and the immediate locality also offers various sporting and leisure establishments to include St Judes GAA, Faughs GAA, Templeogue United Football Club, St. Marys Rugby Club and Templeogue Tennis Club. The area is spoilt for choice with premier schools such as Bishop Shanahan and Bishop Galvin Primary Schools, St. Mac Daras, Templeogue College, Our Lady&s;s and Terenure College Secondary schools to name but a few. This is a mature residential area set in a quiet cul-de-sac and perfect for young families or those who require quick and easy access to the city and connecting road networks. The M50 is only minutes away. There are also a number of Dublin Bus routes nearby.

No. 38 is a charming ready to occupy modernised home with off street parking to the front for two vehicles, side access and a private, not overlooked West facing rear garden.  Located beside UCHG, NUIG and a 10 minute stroll to the social and cultural City Centre.

The house has benefited from recent upgrade with external cladded insulation, double glazed windows, solid timber flooring, NEST remote controls for water, heating and alarm.  The house has bright well proportioned rooms with a bay windowed sitting room, and kitchen / dining room on the ground floor.  On the first floor are three bedrooms, two double and one single and a recently refitted shower room.  There is Stira stairs access to an open, fully floored attic.  The house is fitted to a high standard with solid Walnut timber floors on the ground floor, solid Oak timber doors and skirtings, solid timber cottage style kitchen and a modern shower room.  To the front is off street parking for two cars, a rare advantage in this location, side access to a West facing private rear garden, with two patio areas, mature shrubs, and a garden utility shed.

Colmcille Road is a prime residential location beside UCHG, close to NUIG and a 10 minute walk to the City Centre.  Bus and public transport on your door step.  The residence overlooks a central green to the front. 

This home is ready for immediate occupation and viewings is highly recommended.

property_title: 16 Arranmore, 13-17 Pembroke Road, Ballsbridge, Dublin 4, D04T635
property_description:
Bergins are delighted to introduce to the market this superb one bedroomed apartment situated in this extremely popular development of Arranmore.  Meticulously planned, Arranmore is a purpose built over 55&s;s active retirement development of 38 apartments, perfectly positioned off Pembroke Road in the heart of Dublin 4. 

When Arranmore was originally designed, taking inspiration from the surrounding Georgian buildings, the needs of the residents were very much taken in to consideration.

On arrival you are greeted by a Reception desk off which can be found the communal sitting room which has very tastefully been refurbished, an ideal space to meet guests and fellow residents.

The apartment itself, is a bright and very well laid out apartment extends to 37 sq. m. / 403 sq. ft.(approx.) and is presented in very good order throughout. 

The accommodation in brief comprises; welcoming entrance hall, light filled living/dining room leading to the kitchen, a double bedroom and a shower room.  Also boasting a good sized walk in cupboard in the hall. 

The development has private parking to the front of the building.  There are beautifully landscaped gardens to the rear with water feature and lots of seating areas.

At garden level and accessed via the lift or stairs is a large Laundry room with a number of washing machines and tumble driers as we all as ironing facilities. 

There is a House Manager living on site and each apartment has been fitted with a brand new alarm system in the event that assistance is required.  There is also a Guest suite which can be availed of for Family members.

No. 172 Manor Court is an own door two bed first floor apartment which benefits from having a converted attic.  Built in 2002 by The Kenny Group it is ideally located close to the front of the estate and overlooks the green area with off street parking. 

Manor Court is ideally positioned between the Ballymoneen Road and the Cappagh Road and has all amenities close at hand such as Cappagh Sports Grounds, Gaelscoil Mhic Amhlaigh, Barna Woods, Rusheen Bay and both the Gateway and Knocknacarra Shopping Centres all of which are within easy access.  Salthill Beach and Promenade are only a few minutes&s; drive away.

Accommodation includes a large open plan kitchen/living/dining room, two bedrooms, one of which is en-suite and the main bathroom on the first floor, while the second floor features a large attic storage area spanning the width of the property.  There is also a designated external storage shed at the rear.

This property is in excellent decorative order and is ready for immediate occupation. It would be ideal for first time buyers looking to get onto the property ladder and has excellent transport links for NUIG &a; UCHG.

Viewing is highly recommended.

Sherry FitzGerald O&s;Reilly welcome you to 33 Old Chapel Grove, a very spacious 4 bedroomed detached home in excellent decorative order throughout. This is a bright, appealing, and well-maintained family home with spacious accommodation, perfect for the growing family. It includes a large garden with views of the open fields beyond.
This superb home is located in the picturesque village of Caragh, within walking distance of local amenities such as the primary school, creche, church, playground, bar, restaurant and sporting facilities. It is also just 15 minutes&s; drive to the busy towns of Naas or Newbridge, each with an abundance of shops, restaurants, theatres, cinemas and leisure amenities. The M7 and the rail link at Sallins are just a short drive away.
Accommodation in this fine property briefly comprises hallway, living room, kitchen/dining room, family room, utility room, guest wc, 4 double bedrooms (1 en-suite) and a family bathroom. Outside - concrete built shed.
